verses.verse: "Man, <S%H120><s%> who is born <S%H3205><s%> of a woman, <S%H802><s%> is of few <S%H7116><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> and full <S%H7649><s%> of trouble. <S%H7267><s%>
He comes forth <S%H3318><s%> like a flower, <S%H6731><s%> and is cut down. <S%H5243><s%> He also flees <S%H1272><s%> like a shadow, <S%H6738><s%> and doesn't <S%H5975><s%> continue.
Do you open <S%H6491><s%> your eyes <S%H5869><s%> on such a one, <S%H2088><s%> and bring <S%H935><s%> me into judgment with you? <S%H4941><s%>
Who can bring <S%H5414><s%> a clean <S%H2889><s%> thing out of an unclean? <S%H2931><s%> Not one. <S%H259><s%>

Seeing <S%H518><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%> are determined, <S%H2782><s%> the number <S%H4557><s%> of his months <S%H2320><s%> is with you, <S%H6213><s%> and you have appointed his bounds <S%H2706><s%> that he can't <S%H5674><s%> pass;
Look <S%H8159><s%> away from him, <S%H2308><s%> that he may rest, until he shall accomplish, <S%H7521><s%> as a hireling, <S%H7916><s%> his day. <S%H3117><s%>

"For there is <S%H3426><s%> hope <S%H8615><s%> for a tree, <S%H6086><s%> If it is cut down, <S%H3772><s%> that it will sprout again, <S%H2498><s%> that the tender branch <S%H3127><s%> of it will not cease. <S%H2308><s%>
Though its root <S%H8328><s%> grows old <S%H2204><s%> in the earth, <S%H776><s%> and its stock <S%H1503><s%> dies <S%H4191><s%> in the ground, <S%H6083><s%>
yet through the scent <S%H7381><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%> it will bud, <S%H6524><s%> and put forth <S%H6213><s%> boughs <S%H7105><s%> like a plant. <S%H5194><s%>
But man <S%H1397><s%> dies, <S%H4191><s%> and is laid low. <S%H2522><s%> Yes, <S%H120><s%> man gives up the spirit, <S%H1478><s%> and where is he?
As the waters <S%H4325><s%> fail <S%H235><s%> from the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and the river <S%H5104><s%> wastes <S%H2717><s%> and dries up, <S%H3001><s%>

so man <S%H376><s%> lies down <S%H7901><s%> and doesn't <S%H6965><s%> rise. Until the heavens <S%H8064><s%> are no more, <S%H1115><s%> they shall not awake, <S%H6974><s%> nor be roused out <S%H5782><s%> of their sleep. <S%H8142><s%>

"Oh that <S%H5414><s%> you would hide <S%H6845><s%> me in Sheol, <S%H7585><s%> that you would keep me secret, <S%H5641><s%> until your wrath <S%H639><s%> is past, <S%H7725><s%> that you would appoint <S%H7896><s%> me a set time, <S%H2706><s%> and remember me! <S%H2142><s%>

If a man <S%H1397><s%> dies, <S%H4191><s%> shall he live <S%H2421><s%> again? <S%H3117><s%> All the days of my warfare <S%H6635><s%> would I wait, <S%H3176><s%> until my release <S%H2487><s%> should come. <S%H935><s%>
You would call, <S%H7121><s%> and I would answer <S%H6030><s%> you. <S%H3700><s%> You would have a desire to the work <S%H4639><s%> of your hands. <S%H3027><s%>
But now you number <S%H5608><s%> my steps. <S%H6806><s%> Don't <S%H8104><s%> you watch over my sin? <S%H2403><s%>
My disobedience <S%H6588><s%> is sealed up <S%H2856><s%> in a bag. <S%H6872><s%> You fasten up <S%H2950><s%> my iniquity. <S%H5771><s%>
"But <S%H199><s%> the mountain <S%H2022><s%> falling <S%H5307><s%> comes to nothing. <S%H5034><s%> The rock <S%H6697><s%> is removed <S%H6275><s%> out of its place; <S%H4725><s%>

The waters <S%H4325><s%> wear <S%H7833><s%> the stones. <S%H68><s%> The torrents of it wash away <S%H7857><s%> the <S%H5599><s%> dust <S%H6083><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%> So you destroy <S%H6><s%> the hope <S%H8615><s%> of man. <S%H582><s%>
You forever <S%H5331><s%> prevail <S%H8630><s%> against him, <S%H1980><s%> and he departs. You change <S%H8138><s%> his face, <S%H6440><s%> and send him away. <S%H7971><s%>
His sons <S%H1121><s%> come to honor, <S%H3513><s%> and he doesn't <S%H3045><s%> know it. <S%H6819><s%> They are brought low, but he doesn't <S%H995><s%> perceive it of them.
But his flesh <S%H1320><s%> on him has pain, <S%H3510><s%> and his soul <S%H5315><s%> inside him mourns. <S%H56><s%>"
